fr.sii.ogham.core.util

Class BuilderUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.util.BuilderUtils

  • public final class BuilderUtils
extends Object
    Helper class for Builder implementations. It separates the builder implementations from the environment.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultProperties

        public static Properties getDefaultProperties()
        Provide the default properties. For now, it provides only System.getProperties(). But according to the environment or the future of the module, properties may come from other source.
        Returns:
        the default properties

      • evaluate

        public static <T> T evaluate(String property,
                             PropertyResolver propertyResolver,
                             Class<T> resultClass)
        If the property value is an expression ("${property.key}"), then it is evaluated to get the value of "property.key". If the value is not an expression, the value is returned and converted to the result class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resulting property
        Parameters:
        property - the property that may be an expression
        propertyResolver - the property resolver used to find property value (if it is an expression)
        resultClass - the result class
        Returns:
        the resulting value of the expression, the value or null

      • evaluate

        public static <T> T evaluate(List<String> properties,
                             PropertyResolver propertyResolver,
                             Class<T> resultClass)
        Evaluate a list of properties that may contain expressions. It internally calls evaluate(String, PropertyResolver, Class). It tries on first property in the list. If null value is returned then the next property is tried and so on until one property returns a non-null value.

        If all properties return null, it returns null.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of resulting value
        Parameters:
        properties - the list of properties to try in sequence
        propertyResolver - the property resolver used to find property value (if it is an expression)
        resultClass - the result class
        Returns:
        the resulting value or null

      • getPropertyKey

        public static String getPropertyKey(String expression)
        Get the property of inside the expression
        Parameters:
        expression - the property expression
        Returns:
        the property key

      • isExpression

        public static boolean isExpression(String property)
        Indicates if the property is the form of an expression ("${property.key}") or not.
        Parameters:
        property - the property that may be an expression
        Returns:
        true if it is an expression, false otherwise

        Parameters:

      • instantiateBuilder

        public static <T,B extends Builder<? extends T>,P> B instantiateBuilder(Class<B> builderClass,
                                                                        P parent,
                                                                        BuildContext buildContext)
                                                                 throws BuildException
        Utility method used to dynamically instantiate a builder instance.

        If you want fluent chaining, your builder class MUST declare parent of type P as first parameter. The builder can implement Parent or even extend AbstractParent. For example, if builder is a child of EmailBuilder: 

         
 class MyBuilder extends AbstractParent<EmailBuilder> implements Builder<Foo> {
   public MyBuilder(EmailBuilder parent) {
     super(parent);
   }
 }

        You may need BuildContext in order to be able to evaluate properties in your Builder.build() method. Just declare a parameter of type BuildContext either as first parameter if you don't want fluent chaining: 

         
 class MyBuilder implements Builder<Foo> {
   public MyBuilder(BuildContext buildContext) {
     this.buildContext = buildContext;
   }
 }
        or as second parameter if you want fluent chaining: 
         
 class MyBuilder extends AbstractParent<EmailBuilder> implements Builder<Foo> {
   public MyBuilder(EmailBuilder parent, BuildContext buildContext) {
     super(parent);
     this.buildContext = buildContext;
   }
 }

        If you need none of these features, you still have to provide a public default constructor.

        If several constructors exist, the following order is used (first matching constructor is used):

        • contructor(P parent, BuildContext buildContext)
        • contructor(P parent
        • contructor(BuildContext buildContext)
        • contructor(
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the built object
        B - The type of the builder that builds T
        P - The type of the parent builder (used for fluent chaining)
        Parameters:
        builderClass - The builder class to instantiate
        parent - The parent builder for fluent chaining
        buildContext - The current build context
        Returns:
        the builder instance
        Throws:
        BuildException - when builder can't be instantiated

      • build

        public static <T> T build(Builder<T> builder)
        Build the instance using the provided builder.

        If builder is null, it returns null.

        If builder is not null, the value of Builder.build() is used. The returned value may be null.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the built instance
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder
        Returns:
        the built instance or null if builder is null or if it returns null
